issue.message: Lint found an issue registry (`androidx.appcompat.AppCompatIssueRegistry`) which requires a newer API level. That means that the custom lint checks are intended for a newer lint version; please upgrade

Lint found an issue registry (`timber.lint.TimberIssueRegistry`) which is older than the current API level; these checks may not work correctly.
Recompile the checks against the latest version. Custom check API version is 1 (3.1), current lint API level is 6 (3.6+)

issue.message: Calling `Canvas.getHeight()` is usually wrong; you should be calling `getBounds().getHeight()` instead
Calling `Canvas.getWidth()` is usually wrong; you should be calling `getBounds().getWidth()` instead
Referencing `Canvas.width` is usually wrong; you should be referencing `width` instead
Calling `Canvas.getWidth()` is usually wrong; you should be calling `getWidth()` instead

By convention, the declare-styleable (`SwipeLayout`) for a layout parameter class (`LayoutParams`) is expected to be the surrounding class (`SwipeLayout`) plus "`_Layout`", e.g. `SwipeLayout_Layout`. (Various editor features rely on this convention.)
By convention, the custom view (`TextViewWithPostfix`) and the declare-styleable (`TextViewWithPostFix`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Cannot be relative to self: id=ic_arrow, layout_toStartOf=ic_arrow
Cannot be relative to self: id=ic_arrow, layout_toLeftOf=ic_arrow
Accessing internal APIs via reflection is not supported and may not work on all devices or in the future
